issue.title: script run failed in all conditions

repository.name: kulala.nvim
repository.description: A fully-featured ü§è HTTP-client üêº interface üñ•Ô∏è for Neovim ‚ù§Ô∏è.

issue.body:
script can not run properly, I'm running kulala in a windows powershell, with nodejs installed(v22.11.0), NVIM v0.10.2, and here is my config:
```lua
  {
    'mistweaverco/kulala.nvim',
    ft = { "http" },
    opts = {},
    config = function ()
      local kulala = require("kulala")
      kulala.setup({
        debug = true,
        default_env = "green",
        additional_curl_options = { "--insecure", "-A", "Mozilla/5.0" },
        icons = {
          inlay = {
            loading = "‚è≥",
            done = "‚úÖ",
            error = "‚ùå",
          },
        },
        winbar = true,
        default_winbar_panes = { "body", "headers", "headers_body", "script_output" },
        default_view = "headers_body",
      })
    end
  },
```

everything work just fine before few weeks ago, and here is the error message after run kulala request:
```
Javascript base files not found. Installing dependencies...
D:/DevTools/neovim/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/_system.lua:244: ENOENT: no such file or directory
stack traceback:
^I[C]: in function 'error'
^ID:/DevTools/neovim/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/_system.lua:244: in function 'spawn'
^ID:/DevTools/neovim/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/_system.lua:335: in function 'system'
^I...im/lua/kulala/parser/scripts/engines/javascript/init.lua:26: in function 'install'
^I...im/lua/kulala/parser/scripts/engines/javascript/init.lua:119: in function 'run'
^I...Local/nvim-data/lazy/kulala.nvim/lua/kulala/cmd/init.lua:130: in function <...Local/nvim-data/lazy/kulala.nvim/lua/kulala/cmd/init.lua:103>

```

here is the simple request I test:
```
# @getJsonPlaceHolder
GET https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/posts/2

> {%
  client.log(response.body.json)
%}
```

body:
I think this is expected behaviour. `vim.system` is just a wrapper around `vim.uv.spawn`, and I see no reason to give windows special treatment here.

@dundargoc WDYT?

@lewis6991 This is fundamental IMHO for creating plugins to run on all systems.

Let's assume you want to execute "npm" or "node" to run some stuff, you'll write

```lua
vim.system({"npm", "-l", "someargs"})
```

and everywhere it runs fine (cause alls Un*x favours incl. MacOS) executables names are identical to the callled name.
Windows needs (like DOS) a fileextension to *mark* what filetype it is and if it should be executable.

So all executables (binary excutable / script executable) will have a different name on Windows BUT would be called the same.

No plugin developer will know if it is a .CMD / .BAT wrapper or compiled to .EXE.

To make it runable everyone needs to call `vim.fn.exepath` in front.

I'm with you it to fix at at `vim.uv.spawn` level!

issue.title: fix(vim.system): resolve executable paths on windows

repository.name: neovim
repository.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

issue.title: fix(scripts): windows: js engine build and run

repository.name: kulala.nvim
repository.description: A fully-featured ü§è HTTP-client üêº interface üñ•Ô∏è for Neovim ‚ù§Ô∏è.

issue.body:
This is a workaround for a bug/weird behaviour in neovim: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/31107

Once this has been merged:
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/31109

We can revert this workaround.

Fixes #304

body: Needing to provide a .bat suffix isn't uncommon in general, although it's annoying because it adds friction to cross platform solutions like mentioned. I think it should be "fixed", but I'm unsure at what level. Might be worth taking a look at exepath to see what it does to circumvent this. Sorry for the vague non-answer, I'd need to do more research first before saying anything definitively.

issue.title: mason.nvim doesn't see my python that was installed with pyenv-win

repository.name: mason.nvim
repository.description: Portable package manager for Neovim that runs everywhere Neovim runs. Easily install and manage LSP servers, DAP servers, linters, and formatters.

issue.body:
### I've searched open issues for similar requests

- [X] Yes

### I've recently downloaded the latest plugin version of mason.nvim

- [X] Yes

### Problem description

:checkhealth mason reports that it can't find any python.

I installed python 3.11.9 with pyenv-win that was installed with chocolatey and set it as my global so python and pip both run and display as 3.11.9. My windows path also says that the pythons are added to path, however mason.nvim still can't see the python and thus can't install any python packages.

### Expected behavior

Python detected as installed on my windows machine and packages install successfully.

### Affected packages

All python packages

### Mason output

```Text
mason.nvim 
                                                                   press g? for help
                                                      https://github.com/williamboman/mason.nvim
   (1) All   (2) LSP   (3) DAP   (4) Linter   (5) Formatter  

  Language Filter: press <C-f> to apply filter

  Failed
    ‚óç black
      ‚ñ∂ # [2/2] Unable to find python3 installation in PATH. Tried the following candidates: python, python3.

  Installed
    ‚óç clangd
    ‚óç css-lsp cssls
    ‚óç gopls
    ‚óç html-lsp html
    ‚óç json-lsp jsonls
    ‚óç lua-language-server lua_ls
    ‚óç marksman
    ‚óç pyright
    ‚óç rust-analyzer rust_analyzer
    ‚óç tailwindcss-language-server tailwindcss
    ‚óç typescript-language-server tsserver

  Available
    ‚óç actionlint
    ‚óç ada-language-server als
    ‚óç aiken
    ‚óç alex
    ‚óç angular-language-server angularls
```


### Installation log

```Text
[INFO  7/11/2024 12:04:09 AM] ...m-data/lazy/mason.nvim/lua/mason-core/installer/init.lua:184: Executing installer for Package(name=black) {}
[ERROR 7/11/2024 12:04:09 AM] ...cal/nvim-data/lazy/mason.nvim/lua/mason-core/process.lua:152: Failed to spawn process. cmd="python", err="ENOENT: no such file or directory"
[ERROR 7/11/2024 12:04:09 AM] ...cal/nvim-data/lazy/mason.nvim/lua/mason-core/process.lua:152: Failed to spawn process. cmd="python3", err="ENOENT: no such file or directory"
[ERROR 7/11/2024 12:04:09 AM] ...m-data/lazy/mason.nvim/lua/mason-core/installer/init.lua:249: Installation failed for Package(name=black) error="Unable to find python3 installation in PATH. Tried the following candidates: python, python3."
```


### Neovim version (>= 0.7)

NVIM v0.11.0-dev-387+g158ffd646
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.1720049189

### Operating system/version

Windows 10
